main.name: Tyson Wright
main.occupation: Data Analytics and Information Technology Graduate
main.description: Searching for a role in Data Analytics, Web Development and Software Engineering

about.aboutLine: My name is Tyson Wright, I enjoy using data and programming skills to discover new insights and solve interesting problems.

work.title: Team Member
description: Torquay Warehouse Team Member of the Year 2019.
Provided excellent customer service promptly and courteously and used creative problem solving to ensure customers got the information they needed.

work.title: Front-end Web Developer Intern
description: Responsible for making the codelearn.io site responsive for mobile and tablet devices.
Technologies used: C#, .NET, JavaScript, Git, Bootstrap, Chart.js, CSS & HTML.

work.title: Website Development & Maintenance
description: Implemented the Jan Juc Cricket Club website and online store.
Responsible for maintaining the website, hosting, PayPal and e-commerce.
Technologies used: WordPress, WooCommerce, PayPal API

projects.title: AWS Cloud Services
projects.description: As part of one of my assignments I was tasked with creating a program that would read a configuration file and then send data to WCF services hosted on AWS EC2 instances that would then perform some calculation and return the results to a windows form application to display to the user. The cloud solution I created involved 3 different algorithms running on 3 seperate VM's each for a total of 9 VM's. These were created using AMI's and snapshots. I then created a load balancer that routed the requests to 1 VM from each algorithm. The resulting data was then sent back to the user in order to undergo further calculation and display the final result to the user.

projects.title: CAP
projects.description: For my capstone project I was the Back-End leader for the Capstone Application Portal project. We were asked by the client to make a number of visual and functional changes to a pre-existing website that did not meet the business requirements. Changes were made to the website using PHP, smarty (templating framework) and SQL to display the data dynamically.
